column5: AMAZING day for me today. Went to a hole that I had been scouting for a few weeks that I knew was holding 30 plus fish. Arrived at 4:30 and got 2 before dawn, as soon as first light hit it was non stop with 5 drifts in a row 5 fish landed. I ended up going something like 9/16  but lost count along the way. 2 males, 7 or more females with only one being fresh. Sadly, my camera died on the first picture and my cell camera does not work in the dark! I managed to get one picture off my cell phone around 7 30 AM and some more should be coming to me via email later in the week.  Here she is,
Wtg Kemp, sounds like a pretty successful opener. Good stuff
NICE JOB BRO!!! GLAD TO SEE THEY GOT TO DO THERE BIZ!!!

Good to hear your day on the river was successful Kemper !!  Sounds like the pickings were pretty easy everywhere yesterday, seems like everyone that posted a report of the opener got into a bunch of fish.
Way to go! Pre-season scouting does pay off, no doubt about it!
Sure does pay to do your homework and scouting for those little honey holes.   Congrats.
